data.title: Ctrl+Backspace is too hungry
data.body:
When one erases "empty" text (i.e. tabs) with Ctrl+Backspace, also code is deleted.

An example, let's say I have redundant tabs at the end of a method:

`|` == caret position
`T` == tab

```
func _on_ok_pressed():
    save_settings()
    Game.show_title()
        T
        T
        T  T  T  |
```

Pressing CTRL+Backspace just once erases not only the tabs, but also the `show_title()`

 I find this quite awkward - and I think it'd be better to either:
1. Erase one full row of tabs
2. Just erase all the tabs

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10, Godot 2.2. Alpha custom build

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
See above.

**Steps to reproduce:**
See above.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
N/A

data.title: Fix ability to cut/paste text in LineEdit/TextEdit in readonly mode.
data.body: Fixes #6466

data.title: Listener2D #6517
data.body:
Put together a Listener2D node based off of the Listener(3D). It's cleaned up a bit from Listener, but it _shouldn't_ break anything. The changes in the Viewport class feel hacked in, but it works, though it'd need some testing to make sure nothing broke. Currently lacks an icon in the editor.

Closes #6517

data.title: Building Godot from source fails silently on Windows 8.1
data.body:
I'm currently trying to build Godot from source (master) on Windows 8.1. 
I'm using Python 2.7.12 and Scons 2.5.0.

When I run - "`C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 12.0\VC\vcvarsall.bat" amd64 && scons platform=windows` - the command line prints:

```
scons: Reading SConscript files ...
You need to define ANGLE_SRC_PATH to the path of ANGLE source root.
No valid target platform selected.
The following were detected:
        windows

Please run scons again with argument: platform=<string>
scons: done reading SConscript files.
scons: Building targets ...
scons: `.' is up to date.
scons: done building targets.
```

 With no clear error, I check the /bin folder, but no "godot.windows.tools.*.exe" file is built.
What might I be doing wrong?

data.title: A way to turn off the material preview in the Inspector?
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1, any OS.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
_This is a feature request._

I don't really like the new shader material preview in the inspector, I am already previewing my materials in the viewport and it's kind of a waste of space in the inspector, IMO.

![Illustration](http://picload.org/image/rdrrwclo/inspector_matpreview.png)

Since I couldn't find an option for it:
Would it be possible to get an option to turn it off in the Engine Settings > Inspector Tab.

:sparkles: Pretty please? :sparkles:

data.title: Baking octree generates a PNG file in project root (baked_octree.png)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Debian GNU/Linux

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Light baking generated a file baked_octree.png at the toplevel which is not removed ([responsible code](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/bc6e750f957864d866bad94236212d1a87cebd2d/tools/editor/plugins/baked_light_editor_plugin.cpp#L146)). Godot can instead 1) use a tmpfile with a fixed prefix and remove the file afterwards, 2) provide a path as an option to store the octree lightmap 3) avoid storing it as a file completely.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Add a light with baking enabled under a BakeLightInstance node and press Bake button.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: controls only accepts integer values ​​for set_pos
data.body:
Godot version: v.2.2.alpha.custom_build on linux

Issue description:
controls only accepts integer values ​​for set_pos.
No decimal values accepted.

Steps to reproduce:
create new scene with a TetureFrame control

set_pos(Vector2(1.5,1.5))
print(get_pos()) #print (1, 1) in output

data.title: "Config file does not exist" when templates is a symlink
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Debian GNU/Linux - both 2.1 & git master

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I removed `.godot/templates` and symlinked templates directory from another place and Godot started complaining about non-existing config:

```
WARNING: create: Config file does not exist, creating.
   At: tools/editor/editor_settings.cpp:337
```

And as it said, Godot indeed created new config file, deleting old one. Since it however didn't touch `templates` link, this behaviour persisted and each time i loaded Godot, i got empty config.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- replace `templates/` directory inside `~/.godot` with symlink to directory with templates
- launch godot

data.title: Label's set_text method works like if it was called like this: set_text(tr("key"))
data.body:
Operating system or device - Godot version:

Fedora 24 - 64 Bits. Godot 2.1

Issue description (what happened, and what was expected):

What happened: Label's text was changed by translation string with these key.
What was expected: Label text was changed by a number (or by any other string).

Steps to reproduce:
1. Import translation with number key.
2. Try to change label's text by code. For example: label.set_text("1")

data.title: When stretch-mode set to viewport all viewports pos are set to (0,0)
data.body:
Godot version: 
A windows 64-bit build (September 15, 2016 at 09:28) form [http://fixnum.org/godot/](http://fixnum.org/godot/)

Issue description:
I was testing out the new split-screen 2d viewport stuff with the demo. The only problem I could find with it was, when displays stretch mode is set to viewport. All the viewport's positions are set to (0,0) automatically. So, basically all the viewports just stack on top of each other in the left corner.

Steps to reproduce:

[https://youtu.be/7JPq4hGbbRY](https://youtu.be/7JPq4hGbbRY)

data.title: Compression functions (zlib/gzip/deflate) in GDScript
data.body:
I'm missing ways to compress/decompress data in GDScript. I believe this would be quite useful to compress data to send over network or compressed assets/saves to be used by the game.

Since Godot already bundles zlib, this would not be hard to do for zlib/gzip wrapper formats and pure deflate compression.

data.title: New distraction free mode icon
inst2dict does not turn classes inside classes to dict
Expose Image::set_indexed_pixel, get_indexed_pixel, set_palette methods for GDScript
data.body: I've been trying to work indexed_alpha images.  Currently there's no way to work with the raw array you get from Image.get_data().  While you can edit the palette values of the returned raw array, there doesn't exist a method to set the modified raw data for the image.  So I dug around the source code noticed these methods, though I'm uncertain as to whether they are complete, they sound exactly like what I am looking for, and if they are functional it'd be nice to expose them to GDscript.  I've tried to edit the source code myself, haven't had any luck to edit the core Image class.  Any help would be appreciated, thanks!

data.title: Add a way to change weight_scale on runtime
data.body:
Today i've been using the AStar pathfinding class, and it works really well, but i found myself with a problem, i wanted change the scale of some points to prevent the player from moving over there, but there's no way to change it. Other way to do it was removing all the conections and add them back again, but chaging the weight scale is easier imo, besides, my game will most likely need to have different weight scales for every character (sinces some of them walks, other rides a horse and others flyes) and terrain weigth is linked to this.
So there are 2 things i'd like to be able to do:
1. have a set_weight_scale(int point_id) function
2. have a set_custom_weigth_calculator(object, string function_name)
func function_name(int point_from, int_point_to)

When you are holding down an input key and the game testing halts/crashes, if the text editor is open, the key starts typing in the text editor, and you are bound to ctrl-z every time you have an issue.  Gaaah!!
Want not the input to continue once game test has stopped
**Steps to reproduce:**

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Add scrolling to Tree control in Drag and Drop mode
data.body:
When you want to drag one of nodes in scene tree to position which is out of view you can use mouse wheel. But for me it's hard to use wheel when left mouse button is already down and should stay this way.

I've implemented simple border scrolling - grab a node and move it close to the border or even out of tree control. The further you move the mouse the quicker it will scroll.

Scroll speed and active border size can be set up in theme.
Setting speed to 0 makes the Tree to behave in old way - without border scrolling.

It will not only affect the editor but can be used in the apps you create.

data.title: Game crashed with "Internal Script Error! - opcode #13 (report please)."
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 16.04, x86_64
Godot v2.1.Stable.Official

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
My game is frequently crashing, sometimes showing the above error (with the following text: `Condition 'p_index<0 || p_index>=size()' is true. returned: aux` in the error window) and sometimes without either happening. I was able to get a stack trace on the script where it happened, and it looks like this:

```
func _fixed_process(delta):
    # do some stuff
    # ....
    if position.length() > MAX_DIST:
        free()
    if collider.is_colliding(): # <-- FAILS HERE
        free()
```

`collider` is a KinematicBody2D with a CollisionPolygon2D as its child. (I don't know if I did this part right, as collisions haven't been working so far in my game anyway).

**Steps to reproduce:**
Run a script containing the above code. Watch things explode. Feel the cold steely grip of despair.

With my game specifically: Hold the space bar to launch a space ship, and make it fly off screen. It will occasionally trigger the error.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

[Kinetic Defense Force](https://github.com/galbacarys/KineticSpaceDefense)

data.title: PopupMenu.set_item_checked() checks item with index + 1
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 x64, 2.1 stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Hence the following code and result:
![wtf](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9631152/18609324/b1f36824-7cff-11e6-8bb6-51f6f20c891f.png)
I don't do more than that. It looks like set_item_checked checks the item with the (index + 1) which was provided for `add_check_item`.

This might be a bug or me just misunderstanding the menu API again...

data.title: Expose bottom panel show/hide for plugins
Support 64-bit ARM (ARMv8) on Android
data.body:
Supporting 64-bit ARM (aka. ARMv8) on Android (along with the creation of fat binaries, containing both ARMv7 and ARMv8) would be nice, since it could offer small performance improvements. Many devices from this year such as the OnePlus 3 support ARMv8.

@reduz said it should be relatively easy, it should be a matter of adding a new compilation target for the `libgodot_android.so` file.

data.title: Improvements on class, function, property naming for 3.0
data.body:
Godot API has been barely unchanged for 8 years. For version 3.0 we'll take the chance to break some compatibility to make the API less confusing in many aspects and improving it in others.
Is there any method, functions, class, etc. that you have found confusing in the past, that you would wish it had a different name?
If so, this is the right time to start pointing it out! Feedback will be very welcome!

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6265307/18608298/f3edc02e-7cbb-11e6-85b4-430174ac7b41.png)

data.title: png: Separate and unbundle libpng from Godot loader
data.body:
Related to #6157. Also added the libpng LICENSE file.

Basically what this PR does is:
- move all upstream libpng files from `drivers/png` to `drivers/png/thirdparty/libpng`, thus making it clear which files are Godot's, and which aren't
- adapt the SCsub accordingly
- allow to build against the system-wide libpng version (on Linux only for now, other platforms would likely error out if `png=system` is passed)

Feedback welcome.

data.title: Have add_child return a value.
data.body:
**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
As per http://docs.godotengine.org/en/latest/classes/class_node.html?highlight=add_child currently add_child currently returns void when called. I think it might be helpful for add_child to instead return a value.

I'm thinking it should:
- Return the absolute path of the added node if valid/correct. So if the new parent was "/root/nodRootMain" and the function was add_child (SceneMe) where the root node of SceneMe was "a_scene", it'd return "/root/nodRootMain/a_scene".
- Alternatively, return the resultant node object.
- Return something else (null, an ERR_ condition etc) if invalid.

data.title: Expose EditorNode to plugins
data.body:
The core editor plugins have major advantage over GDScript plugins: the access to the `EditorNode` singleton. Many of the `EditorPlugin` functions are just wrappers to `EditorNode` methods.

The core C++ plugins are quite good examples on how to extend the editor but they require unavailable API. For instance, the Theme editor is quite good for being context sensitive. You can't do that in a custom plugin since it's impossible to show and hide the bottom panel without access to `EditorNode`.

Is there a reason why `EditorNode` is not fully exposed?

The alternative, of course, is making more `EditorNode` wrappers inside `EditorPlugin` like I did in #6516.

data.title: Add modulate (color) to TileSet tiles
data.body:
Tiles now get the modulate color of their source `Sprite`.

Non-breaking change: for tile sets generated before this, the modulate color defaults to white (as if this PR had never existed).

data.title: when graphics drivers crash : warn user and close godot zombie, fixes #6502
data.body:
edit : The generic purpose of this patch is to **detects when the GLES2 module turns Godot into a zombie process because the graphics drivers crashed in the middle of a blocking process**.

Under Windows, AMD drivers around version 16.7.3 have a bug that make
them crash and reset on OpenGL initialisation when DualGraphics
CrossFire is enabled. (**edit :** this bug exists since at least DOOM3 and RAGE release, and is thus not likely to be fixed anytime soon by AMD.)

Godot.exe will then become a zombie process.

This hack/workaround adds a timeout mechanism that will warn and inform
the user that the timeout might be caused by a buggy graphics driver,
and that will kill the Godot zombie process.

The timeout is set to occurs after 10 seconds.

When AMD will have fixed their drivers, this workaround will be
transparent and might be removed. (**edit :** this bug exists since at least DOOM3 and RAGE release, and is thus not likely to be fixed anytime soon by AMD.)

Fixes #6502

data.title: Listener2D
data.body: There's a Listener for Spatial but there's no Listener2D for 2D positional audio, which is tied to the viewport position.
